data.name: _add_library_name
data.value: Name to give the spectral library in an –-add-library-path operation.

data.name: _add_library_path
data.value: Specify a spectral library to be added to the open document.

data.name: _batch_commands
data.value: Runs a file line by line treating each line like a SkylineRunner/Cmd input. Useful for automating the execution of multiple commands. The open Skyline file remains active through all commands.

data.name: _chromatogram_base_peaks
data.value: Export base peak chromatograms. Requires the --chromatogram-file argument.

data.name: _chromatogram_file
data.value: The path to the tab delimited file to export chromatograms to. Defaults to exporting precursors and products.

data.name: _chromatogram_precursors
data.value: Export precursor ion chromatograms. Requires the --chromatogram-file argument.

data.name: _chromatogram_products
data.value: Export product ion chromatograms. Requires the --chromatogram-file argument.

data.name: _chromatogram_tics
data.value: Export total ion current chromatograms. Requires the --chromatogram-file argument.

data.name: _decoys_add
data.value: Add decoys to a template document for reintegrate model generation with mProphet. (decoy generation method is optional and defaults to “reverse”)

data.name: _decoys_add_count
data.value: A number of decoys to add. (optional – default is to generate as many decoys as targets)

data.name: _dir
data.value: Used to specify a default root directory for all other path arguments, other than the directory in which the command is run.

data.name: _exp_file
data.value: Path to the method or transition list file (or directory) to export to. This option is required for method and transition list export.

data.name: _exp_ignore_proteins
data.value: Ignore protein boundaries in creating methods.

data.name: _exp_isolationlist_instrument
data.value: Export an isolation list. This option is required for exporting an isolation list and has no default. This option cannot be used with -–exp-translist-instrument or –exp-method-instrument, because you cannot export an isolation list and a transition list or method simultaneously.

data.name: _exp_max_trans
data.value: Maximum number of transitions per injection for export strategies “protein” and “buckets” OR maximum number of simultaneous transitions for scheduled methods. The default is 100.

data.name: _exp_method_instrument
data.value: Export a method. This option is required for exporting a method and has no default. This option cannot be used with --exp-isolationlist-instrument or --exp-translist-instrument, because you cannot export a method and an isolation/transition list simultaneously.

data.name: _exp_method_type
data.value: Sets a standard, scheduled or triggered method. The default is “standard”.

data.name: _exp_optimizing
data.value: Export a method with extra transitions for finding optimal collision energy or declustering potential.

data.name: _exp_polarity
data.value: Controls export behavior for documents with both positive and negative transitions. Allows for output of only positive or only negative transitions, or creates separate outputs for each polarity. Defaults to all, and is ignored for single polarity documents.

data.name: _exp_primary_count
data.value: For --exp-method-type=triggered specifies the number of transitions to make primary.

data.name: _exp_scheduling_replicate
data.value: Use this only if creating a scheduled or triggered method. The default is to schedule based on an average of all replicates, but if you specify one, the method will be scheduled based on that replicate.

data.name: _exp_strategy
data.value: Strategy for dividing a method into injections. The default is “single”.

data.name: _exp_template
data.value: Path of the method template. This can be a file or a directory depending on your instrument. This option is required for method export.

data.name: _exp_translist_instrument
data.value: Export a transition list. This option is required for exporting a transition list and has no default. This option cannot be used with --exp-isolation-list or --exp-method-instrument, because you cannot export a transition list and an isolation list or method simultaneously.

data.name: _help
data.value: Shows this text.

data.name: _ignore_transition_errors
data.value: When present imports all recognized transitions from a transition list or assay library, with error rows reported as warnings.

data.name: _import_all
data.value: Imports from a folder all files or sub-folders which are not already in the document, naming each with the base-name of the file or sub-folder, unless the --import-naming-pattern parameter is also supplied. If --import-replicate-name is supplied, then all files are added to one multi-injection replicate.

data.name: _import_all_files
data.value: Imports from a folder all files but not subfolders which are not already in the document, naming each with the base-name of the file, unless the --import-naming-pattern parameter is also supplied. If --import-replicate-name is supplied, then all files are added to one multi-injection replicate.

data.name: _import_append
data.value: Append the import-file to the given replicate. This is an intention check in case the document already has a replicate with the given name. By default this is set to false. This option only works with the -–import-file option.

data.name: _import_assay_library
data.value: Import an assay library transition list with columns for iRT and relative product ion abundance to create an iRT calculator and spectral library for enhanced peak picking.

data.name: _import_before
data.value: When importing from a folder, only import from files with modified time before the given date.

data.name: _import_document
data.value: Import another Skyline document file into the open document. This may be specified multiple times for multiple files.

data.name: _import_document_merge_peptides
data.value: Matching peptides are merged if used, otherwise not.

data.name: _import_document_results
data.value: Determines how any results in the imported document are handled. The default is to remove them.

data.name: _import_fasta
data.value: Import a FASTA file into the open document.

data.name: _import_file
data.value: Attach a replicate to the open document.

data.name: _import_lockmass_negative
data.value: Waters lockmass correction m/z for negative ion scans.

data.name: _import_lockmass_positive
data.value: Waters lockmass correction m/z for positive ion scans.

data.name: _import_lockmass_tolerance
data.value: Waters lockmass correction tolerance m/z.

data.name: _import_naming_pattern
data.value: A regular expression from which the first group will be used to name replicates in an --import-all operation (e.g. [^_]_(.*) for everything after the first underscore).

data.name: _import_no_join
data.value: Import results files to individual .skyd files without joining them to the main document .skyd file. This is useful for distributed processing, as on HPC cluster.

data.name: _import_on_or_after
data.value: When importing from a folder, only import from files with modified time on or after the given date.

data.name: _import_optimizing
data.value: Indicates the data being imported contains extra transitions for detecting optimal collision energy or declustering potential.

data.name: _import_peak_boundaries
data.value: Read peak boundaries from a comma or tab separated file

data.name: _import_process_count
data.value: A number of sub-processes will be run for single-file import, after which the results from each single file will be joined by the main process. This can produce 10x performance gains on24-core NUMA servers and 3-4x even on i7 processors, under the right conditions. Be sure to test with your system.

data.name: _import_replicate_name
data.value: Name to give the new replicate in an –import-file operation.

data.name: _import_search_add_mods
data.value: Adds all modifications found in peptide search results files to the open document.

data.name: _import_search_cutoff_score
data.value: Defines a cutoff score (between 0 and 1) to be used when building a spectral library from peptide search results files, where 1 is for highest confidence matches and 0 includes everything. [default 0.95]

data.name: _import_search_irts
data.value: Name of iRT standard to to be used when building a spectral library.

data.name: _import_search_num_cirts
data.value: Specify the number of CiRT peptides to use as iRT standards if building a spectral library with CiRT peptides as iRT standards.

data.name: _import_search_recalibrate_irts
data.value: If building a spectral library with iRT standards, recalibrate the iRT standard values relative to the peptides being added.

data.name: _import_search_file
data.value: Import a peptide search results file into the open document, building a document-specific spectral library. This may be specified multiple times for multiple files. Use –import-fasta argument to add matched peptides as targets.

data.name: _import_search_include_ambiguous
data.value: Prevent spectra with multiple ambiguous peptide matches from being discarded when building the spectral library.

data.name: _import_search_prefer_embedded_spectra
data.value: For MaxQuant msms.txt files to force use of the spectra in the file rather than opening raw data files for the original spectra. The MaxQuant msms.txt files contain charge-state deconvoluted spectra which may not be appropriate for target selection.

data.name: _import_threads
data.value: A number of files will be imported in parallel using threads in the main process (equivalent to “Files to import simultaneously” in the user interface), after which the results from each single file will be joined. This can produce 2-4x performance gains under the right conditions. Be sure to test with your system.

data.name: _import_transition_list
data.value: Import a simple transition list with Q1, Q3 and peptide sequence. Also supports molecule transition lists in CSV format with suitable headers.

data.name: _import_warn_on_failure
data.value: If importing a file fails with an error the message is emitted as a warning, the replicate is removed, and importing continues to completion.

data.name: _in
data.value: Open a Skyline file

data.name: _irt_calc_name
data.value: The name for the iRT calculator created during assay library import. (optional) The default name is the document base name.

data.name: _irt_database_path
data.value: The path to an existing iRT calculator (.irtdb file) to be used with an imported assay library. Or, if –irt-standards-group-name or –irt-standards-file are used, then this is the output path for the created .irtdb file. (optional) The default iRT calculator path is path/to/document.irtdb

data.name: _irt_standards_file
data.value: The path to a separate assay library containing the iRT standards to be applied to an imported assay library. (optional)

data.name: _irt_standards_group_name
data.value: The name of a protein or peptide list containing the iRT standards within an imported assay library. (optional)

data.name: _keep_empty_proteins
data.value: Keeps any empty proteins in the open document after importing a FASTA file.

data.name: _log_file
data.value: Sends all logged output to a file.

data.name: _memstamp
data.value: All logging output will be preceded by two memory usage values managed and process private bytes in MB, rounded to the nearest MB.

data.name: _out
data.value: Same as save except writes to the specified file

data.name: _reintegrate_create_model
data.value: This option will cause a new model to be created, using the mProphet algorithm with all available scores for the results found in the document. (requires --reintegrate-model-name)

data.name: _reintegrate_exclude_feature
data.value: Use to exclude a particular feature score by name from the model. Names can be found in the user interface. This argument may be used multiple times to exclude multiple features.

data.name: _reintegrate_log_training
data.value: Causes detailed information about model training to be logged.

data.name: _reintegrate_model_both
data.value: Forces the use of both decoys and second best peaks during reintegration. The default is to use decoys only.

data.name: _reintegrate_model_iteration_count
data.value: Can be used to control the number of iterations performed during model creation. By default up to 10 are allowed and iterations stop when a new model produces fewer detections.

data.name: _reintegrate_model_name
data.value: The name of a scoring model to use for the reintegrate operation. The model can either be pre-defined (e.g. using the Edit > Refine > Reintegrate form) or created automatically during this operation by using --reintegrate-create-model.

data.name: _reintegrate_model_second_best
data.value: Forces the use of second best peaks during reintegration. The default is to use decoys only.

data.name: _reintegrate_overwrite_peaks
data.value: Existing manually integrated peaks will be overwritten with peaks chosen by the reintegration model. (requires --reintegrate-model-name)

data.name: _remove_all
data.value: Remove all results from the open document.

data.name: _remove_before
data.value: Remove all results from the open document with an acquired time before the given date.

data.name: _report_add
data.value: Add reports from a saved report template file to the running program.

data.name: _report_conflict_resolution
data.value: Specifies how to resolve report name conflicts, by either overwriting or skipping them, when using --report-add (default is to output an error message for conflicts)

data.name: _report_file
data.value: The path to export the report to. Required if --report-name is specified.

data.name: _report_format
data.value: CSV for comma-separated reports (or semicolon separated, depending on your localization) or TSV for tab separated reports [default CSV]

data.name: _report_invariant
data.value: Exports the report with the “Invariant” language setting, using English (US) number formats and header text without spaces, ideal for use with the R statistical programming environment.

data.name: _report_name
data.value: The name of a report to export as it appears in the Skyline Export Report form.

data.name: _save
data.value: Saves any changes to the file

data.name: _share_type
data.value: Specifies the type, 'minimal' or 'complete', of archive to share when --share-zip is specified. Minimal is the default attempting to reduce the size of the archive to the minimum necessary to represent the targets in the document while 'complete' maintains full fidelity of all project files.

data.name: _share_zip
data.value: Saves the entire project (document, results, libraries, etc.) to a ZIP archive. Defaults to a minimal archive.

data.name: _timestamp
data.value: All logging output will be preceded by a time and date.

data.name: CommandArgGroup_ToString_Argument
data.value: Argument

data.name: CommandArgGroup_ToString_Description
data.value: Description

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_GENERAL_IO_General_input_output
data.value: General input/output

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_IMPORT_Importing_results_replicates
data.value: Importing results replicates

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_REMOVE_Removing_results_replicates
data.value: Removing results replicates

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_IMPORT_DOC_Importing_other_Skyline_documents
data.value: Importing other Skyline documents

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_FASTA_Importing_FASTA_files
data.value: Importing FASTA files

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_IMPORT_LIST_Importing_transition_lists_and_assay_libraries
data.value: Importing transition lists and assay libraries

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_ADD_LIBRARY_Adding_spectral_libraries
data.value: Adding spectral libraries

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_REINTEGRATE_Reintegrate_with_advanced_peak_picking_models
data.value: Reintegrate with advanced peak picking models

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_REPORT_Exporting_reports
data.value: Exporting reports

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_CHROMATOGRAM_Exporting_chromatograms
data.value: Exporting chromatograms

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_IMPORT_SEARCH_Importing_peptide_searches
data.value: Importing peptide searches

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_LISTS_Exporting_isolation_transition_lists
data.value: Exporting isolation/transition lists

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_METHOD_Exporting_native_instrument_methods
data.value: Exporting native instrument methods

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_EXP_GENERAL_Method_and_transition_list_options
data.value: Method and transition list options

data.name: CommandArgs_Usage_To_access_the_command_line_interface_for_Skyline_you_can_use_either_SkylineRunner_exe_or_SkylineCmd_exe_
data.value: To access the command-line interface for Skyline you can use either SkylineRunner.exe or SkylineCmd.exe.

data.name: CommandArgs_Usage_
data.value: SkylineRunner.exe is a tiny shim executable less than 10 KB in size. It requires a Skyline installation, performed with the self-updating web installers, on the computer on which SkylineRunner is run. SkylineRunner simply starts a separate Skyline process running without any user interface, pipes the parameter options from the command-line to the running Skyline instance, and prints output from its Skyline instance to the command console. You can still run multiple instances of SkylineRunner and it will start multiple instances of Skyline. The Skyline instance started by SkylineRunner is independent of any other instances that may already be running on the same machine. It is not necessary to have a visible instance of Skyline running on your computer for SkylineRunner to work.

data.name: CommandArgs_Usage_para2
data.value: SkylineRunner.exe is a tiny shim executable less than 10 KB in size. It requires a Skyline installation, performed with the self-updating web installers, on the computer on which SkylineRunner is run. SkylineRunner simply starts a separate Skyline process running without any user interface, pipes the parameter options from the command-line to the running Skyline instance, and prints output from its Skyline instance to the command console. You can still run multiple instances of SkylineRunner and it will start multiple instances of Skyline. The Skyline instance started by SkylineRunner is independent of any other instances that may already be running on the same machine. It is not necessary to have a visible instance of Skyline running on your computer for SkylineRunner to work.

data.name: CommandArgs_Usage_para3
data.value: SkylineCmd.exe is a much simpler executable which is always installed beside Skyline.exe. It uses the Skyline.exe module as a DLL providing a much cleaner command-line implementation than SkylineRunner.exe, but you must know where SkylineCmd.exe lives on disk to run it, which is usually not the case with the web installer. Usually, you will use either the “Unplugged” installer or the Administrator installer (or recently the Wine Docker Container for Linux systems) if you want to use SkylineCmd.exe. The “Unplugged” installer comes in a ZIP file and you can just unzip it, find SkylineCmd.exe and run it in-place. The Administrator installer puts SkylineCmd.exe in C:\Program Files\Skyline.

data.name: CommandArgs_Usage_para4
data.value: The Skyline command-line interface is intended for automating tasks such as quality control, scheduling and refinement, during acquisition. With the Skyline command-line interface, you can open a Skyline document, import a newly acquired data file, and export a report or new method. You can also run large-scale chromatogram extraction and peak picking for proteomewide DIA and DDA experiments faster and consuming less memory than using the full graphic user interface. (See Webinar 14: https://skyline.ms/webinar14.url)

data.name: CommandArgs_Usage_Until_the_section_titled_Settings_Customization_all_other_command_line_arguments_rely_on_the____in__argument_because_they_all_rely_on_having_a_Skyline_document_open_
data.value: Until the section titled Settings Customization all other command line arguments rely on the '--in' argument because they all rely on having a Skyline document open.

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_PANORAMA_Publishing_to_Panorama
data.value: Publishing to Panorama

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_PANORAMA_postamble
data.value: If the arguments above are used along with arguments to import results files into the document (--import-file or -–import-all) the Skyline document will be uploaded to the given Panorama server only if new results are added to the document.

data.name: _full_scan_precursor_res
data.value: Resolving power of the precursor mass analyzer. If the mass analyzer is 'Centroided' the value is in PPM.

data.name: _full_scan_precursor_res_mz
data.value: The m/z value at which the precursor mass analyzer resolving power is specified. (applies only to orbitrap and ft_icr mass analyzers)

data.name: _full_scan_product_res
data.value: Resolving power of the product mass analyzer. If the mass analyzer is 'Centroided' the value is in PPM.

data.name: _full_scan_product_res_mz
data.value: The m/z value at which the product mass analyzer resolving power is specified. (applies only to orbitrap and ft_icr mass analyzers)

data.name: _full_scan_rt_filter_tolerance
data.value: The number of minutes on either side of the predicted time or MS/MS IDs, i.e. ± minutes.

data.name: _panorama_folder
data.value: The path to a folder on the Panorama server to which the file is to be published (e.g. MyProject/MyFolder).

data.name: _panorama_password
data.value: The password for a user with access to publish to the Panorama server.

data.name: _panorama_server
data.value: URL of the Panorama server to which the --in file is to be published. The URL should contain the protocol (http or https), hostname and port, if required. Examples: https://panoramaweb.org or http://localhost:8080

data.name: _panorama_username
data.value: The username/email address for a user with access to publish to the Panorama server.

data.name: _tool_add
data.value: The name of a tool to be added by its settings rather than an installation ZIP file.

data.name: _tool_add_zip
data.value: Import tools from a tool installation ZIP file.

data.name: _tool_arguments
data.value: Optional command-line arguments for the tool to be added, used when the tool is executed. (Not applicable to web URL commands)

data.name: _tool_command
data.value: The command or webpage URL to run for a command being added by its settings rather than an installation ZIP file.

data.name: _tool_conflict_resolution
data.value: Tells how to resolve a tool name conflict, by either overwriting an existing installation or skipping installation of the new tool.

data.name: _tool_ignore_required_packages
data.value: Ignore required packages when installing a tool from a ZIP file.

data.name: _tool_initial_dir
data.value: Optional initial directory for the tool to be added, used when the tool is executed. (Not applicable to web URL commands)

data.name: _tool_list_export
data.value: Exports all the tools in the Tools menu to a text file as line separated lists of arguments for --batch-commands.

data.name: _tool_output_to_immediate_window
data.value: When present the tool output is piped to the Immediate Window at runtime.

data.name: _tool_program_macro
data.value: Specifies a program title and version to use with the -–tool-program-path command. Together these commands are for importing tools from a ZIP file that use the $(ProgramPath()) macro as their command. For more information see the documentation on External Tools. e.g. --tool-program-macro=R,2.15.2

data.name: _tool_program_path
data.value: Specifies the path to an executable on the local machine for the program title and version specified by the --tool-program-macro flag.

data.name: _tool_report
data.value: The name of a report in the settings to use as the input report for the tool.

data.name: _tool_zip_conflict_resolution
data.value: Specify whether tool conflicts from the provided ZIP file should be resolved by overwriting or installing in parallel. This is for conflicts related to tool versioning and report names.

data.name: _tool_zip_overwrite_annotations
data.value: Specify whether conflicting custom annotations from the provided ZIP file should overwrite (true) existing annotations or be skipped (false).

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_SETTINGS_Document_Settings
data.value: Document Settings

data.name: CommandArgs_PATH_TO_FILE_path_to_file
data.value: path/to/file

data.name: CommandArgs_PATH_TO_FOLDER
data.value: path/to/folder

data.name: CommandArgs_DATE_VALUE
data.value: <date>

data.name: CommandArgs_INT_VALUE
data.value: <integer>

data.name: CommandArgs_NUM_VALUE
data.value: <number>

data.name: CommandArgs_NAME_VALUE
data.value: <name>

data.name: CommandArgs_FEATURE_NAME_VALUE
data.value: <feature name>

data.name: CommandArgs_REPORT_NAME_VALUE
data.value: <report name>

data.name: CommandArgs_PIPE_NAME_VALUE
data.value: <pipe name>

data.name: CommandArgs_REGEX_VALUE
data.value: <reg-ex>

data.name: CommandArgs_RP_VALUE
data.value: <resolving power>

data.name: CommandArgs_MZ_VALUE
data.value: <m/z value>

data.name: CommandArgs_MINUTES_VALUE
data.value: <minutes>

data.name: CommandArgs_MILLIS_VALE
data.value: <millis>

data.name: CommandArgs_SERVER_URL_VALUE
data.value: <server url>

data.name: CommandArgs_USERNAME_VALUE
data.value: <username>

data.name: CommandArgs_PASSWORD_VALUE
data.value: <password>

data.name: CommandArgs_COMMAND_VALUE
data.value: <command | url>

data.name: CommandArgs_COMMAND_ARGUMENTS_VALUE
data.value: "<arguments>"

data.name: CommandArgs_PROGRAM_MACRO_VALUE
data.value: <program title>[,<program version>]

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_ANNOTATIONS_Importing_annotations
data.value: Importing annotations

data.name: CommandArgGroup_ToString_Applies_To
data.value: Applies To

data.name: CommandArgs_ARG_EXP_DWELL_TIME_AppliesTo
data.value: Agilent SCIEX

data.name: CommandArgs_ARG_EXP_Thermo
data.value: Thermo

data.name: CommandArgs_ARG_EXP_RUN_LENGTH_AppliesTo
data.value: Thermo Waters

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_EXP_INSTRUMENT_Vendor_specific_method_and_transition_list_options
data.value: Vendor-specific method and transition list options

data.name: _exp_add_energy_ramp
data.value: Adds an extra column for energy ramp to the transition list. Optional. Defaults to false.

data.name: _exp_dwell_time
data.value: Dwell time per transition. This option is required for unscheduled transition lists.

data.name: _exp_run_length
data.value: Run length of the entire gradient in minutes. This option is required for unscheduled experiments.

data.name: _exp_use_s_lens
data.value: Adds an extra column for SLens (which defaults to 50) to the transition list. Optional. Defaults to false.

data.name: _import_annotations
data.value: Imports annotations from a CSV file into the document. Use File > Export > Annotations to create example files of the required format with paths to associate the annotations to document elements.

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_DECOYS
data.value: Adding decoy peptides

data.name: _decoys_discard
data.value: Forces any existing decoys to be discarded when --decoys-add is used.

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_INTERNAL
data.value: Internal use only

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_REFINEMENT
data.value: Refining the targets list

data.name: _refine_add_label_type
data.value: Add back precursors of an isotope label type.

data.name: _refine_auto_select_peptides
data.value: All proteins will be reset to auto-select the peptides they contain.

data.name: _refine_auto_select_precursors
data.value: All peptides will be reset to auto-select the precursors they contain.

data.name: _refine_auto_select_transitions
data.value: All precursors will be reset to auto-select the transitions they contain.

data.name: _refine_label_type
data.value: Precursors of the specified isotope label type will be removed (default) or added if --refine-add-label-type is also used.

data.name: _refine_min_peptides
data.value: Proteins with fewer than this number of peptides will be removed from the document.

data.name: _refine_min_transitions
data.value: Precursors with fewer than this number of transitions will be removed from the document.

data.name: _refine_missing_library
data.value: All targets that do not correspond to a library match will be removed.

data.name: _refine_remove_duplicates
data.value: All peptides that are not unique within the document will be removed.

data.name: _refine_remove_repeats
data.value: All repeated peptides will be removed to leave only the first occurrence of any peptide.

data.name: CommandArgs_LABEL_VALUE
data.value: <label type>

data.name: _refine_max_peak_found_ratio
data.value:
All elements with peak found ratio above this number will be removed from the document:
Green = 1.0 Orange >= 0.5 Red < 0.5

data.name: _refine_max_peptide_peak_rank
data.value: All transitions with an average area peak ranking greater than this number will be removed from the document.

data.name: _refine_max_transition_peak_rank
data.value: All transitions with an average area peak ranking greater than this number will be removed from the document.

data.name: _refine_min_dotp
data.value: All precursors with a product ion peak area to library spectrum dot-product below this threshold will be removed from the document.

data.name: _refine_min_idotp
data.value: All precursors with a MS1 precursor peak area to expected isotope distribution dot-product below this threshold will be removed from the document.

data.name: _refine_min_peak_found_ratio
data.value:
All elements with peak found ratio below this number will be removed from the document:
Green = 1.0 Orange >= 0.5 Red < 0.5

data.name: _refine_min_time_correlation
data.value: Precursors will be removed from the document until the target value for the correlation coefficient of a linear regression with the optimal retention time calculator exceed this threshold.

data.name: _refine_missing_results
data.value: All elements without measured results will be removed from the document.

data.name: _refine_prefer_larger_products
data.value: Causes refinement to choose larger product ions when smaller, less selective ions yeild only fractionally greater peak area.

data.name: _refine_use_best_result
data.value: Use only the best replicate for each peptide in refinement value calculations. (use for fractionation)

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_REFINEMENT_W_RESULTS
data.value: Refining the targets list based on imported results

data.name: _tran_precursor_ion_charges
data.value: A comma-separated list of precursor ion charge states to apply to peptide molecules to generate precursor targets. Changes the transition filter settings for the open document.

data.name: _tran_product_ion_charges
data.value: A comma-separated list of product ion charge states to apply to peptide fragments to generate product ion transitions. Changes the transition filter settings for the open document.

data.name: _tran_product_ion_types
data.value: A comma-separated list of product ion types expected in peptide fragmentation to generate product ion transitions. Changes the transition filter settings for the open document.

data.name: _refine_max_precursor_only
data.value: Only the precursor charge state with the maximum peak area will be retained.

data.name: _refine_cv_remove_above_cutoff
data.value: All target precursors with peak area CV above the cutoff will be removed.

data.name: _refine_cv_global_normalize
data.value: Areas used in CV calculations are normalized as specified. (default no normalization)

data.name: _refine_cv_reference_normalize
data.value: Areas used in CV calculations are normalized to a reference type, e.g. "heavy".

data.name: _refine_qvalue_cutoff
data.value: All target precursors with a maximum detection q value above the cutoff will be removed. If --refine-minimum-detections is used then at least the specified number of replicates must have a detection q value below the cutoff.

data.name: _refine_minimum_detections
data.value: All target precursors with less than the specified number of replicates with detection q value below the --refine-qvalue-cutoff are removed.

data.name: _import_filename_pattern
data.value: A regular expression that is applied to file names to select the ones that will be imported.

data.name: _import_samplename_pattern
data.value: A regular expression that is applied to sample names (e.g. in a multi-injection .wiff file) to select the ones that will be imported.

data.name: _exp_order_by_mz
data.value: Order exported method by m/z values in ascending order (precursor m/z, then product m/z when applicable) for optimized quadrupole switching.

data.name: _tran_predict_ce
data.value: Changes the transition settings collision energy prediction setting to one of the previously defined options.

data.name: _tran_predict_cov
data.value: Changes the transition settings compensation voltage prediction setting to one of the previously defined options.

data.name: _tran_predict_dp
data.value: Changes the transition settings declustering potential prediction setting to one of the previously defined options.

data.name: _tran_predict_optdb
data.value: Changes the transition settings optimization library used in predicting instrument parameters to one of the previously defined options.

data.name: _version
data.value: Emits version information for the running installation

data.name: _save_settings
data.value: Causes settings changes to the global environment, e.g. added reports, libraries, enzymes, etc. to be saved to the program configuration file.

data.name: _refine_cv_transitions
data.value: Specifies the transitions for which peak areas are summed and used in CV calculations for CV refinement. (either all or a single best transition)

data.name: _refine_cv_transitions_count
data.value: Specifies the count of transitions selected by library transition rank (isotopes for precursors and library for fragments) for which peak areas are summed and used in CV calculations for CV refinement.

data.name: _refine_cv_ms_level
data.value: The MS level used in the CV calculations. Defaults to "products" which will usually have lower CVs than precursors in methods like PRM and DIA.

data.name: _reintegrate_model_type
data.value: The type of peak scoring model to train to produce z scores and q values. (dafault mProphet) Skyline - simply scales coefficients of the default Skyline model to estimate a unit normal distribution from the decoys. SkylineML - uses the mProphet machine learning algorithm to train a model using only the default set of feature scores.

data.name: CommandArgs_NUM_LIST_VALUE
data.value: <number list>

data.name: _ims_library_res
data.value: Resolving power of ion mobility dimension used to filter around ion mobility values from the spectral libraries.

data.name: _refine_gc_fold_change_cutoff
data.value: Keep only targets with a group comparision fold change above this cutoff. (optional for group comparison refinement)

data.name: _refine_gc_ms_level
data.value: The MS level (1 or 2) to use in calculating peak areas for a group comparison refinement. Defaults to level 2 if both levels are present, and otherwise uses whichever level is present.

data.name: _refine_gc_name
data.value: The name of a previously defined group comparison to use in refining for significantly changing targets. Specify the argument multiple times with multiple names to keep the union of multiple comparisons.

data.name: _refine_gc_p_value_cutoff
data.value: Keep only targets with a group comparison adjusted p value below the specified cut-off. (required for group comparison refinement)

data.name: CommandArgs_GROUP_MINIMIZE_RESULTS_Minimizing_results_file_size
data.value: Minimizing results file size

data.name: _chromatograms_discard_unused
data.value: Discard all unused chromatograms from the document.

data.name: _chromatograms_limit_noise
data.value: Limits the length of the chromatagrams to a number of minutes around the chromatogram peak, i.e. ± minutes.
